“None of us are beauties," Mirren, 79, told the group — which also included Kathy Bates, Parker Posey, Niecy Nash-Betts, Keri Russell and Cristin Milioti  —  during The Hollywood Reporter’s annual roundtable of dramatic female actors.
The conversation about appearances started when the panel discussed some of the bad advice they received during their careers. "I was told to have a nose job in my 20s," Mirren recalled.
“Someone said, ‘You’ll never get work if you don’t have a nose job.’ I said no. I didn’t want to be a pretty actress anyway. I elected to be not so pretty,” she added.
Mirren's recollection surprised the others, including Nash-Betts, 55, who said while she likes looking her best in real life, she's all for looking "like a dog" onscreen if a role demands it.
"I feel sorry for people who have been beautiful their whole life," said Nash-Betts. "Because when that’s what you’re known for, you got to keep it up for your whole life? I don’t know what I’d do."
At that point, Bates, 76, chimed in to say that no matter what an actor really looks like, they are "beautiful" when they deliver "an amazing performance."
"They're hot!" agreed Milioti, 39.
That's when Mirren weighed in on the group's attractiveness. "Looking at our faces around this table, none of us are beautiful," she told the others.
Bates, who's made headlines for both her starring role in CBS's "Matlock" reboot and her 100-pound weight loss, shot back, "Oh, get out of town! I feel more beautiful than I have in my entire life."
But Mirren insisted. "We’re not. None of us are beauties. We all have really different faces, very interesting faces," she said.
Russell, 49, asked Mirren if she meant none of them were "model beautiful."
"We all know what 'beautiful' is like," Mirren replied.
Russell then made everyone the table laugh by quipping, "Kathy’s like, 'Speak for yourself.'"

title: JoJo Siwa confirms she and Chris Hughes are dating after meeting on 'Celebrity Big Brother UK'
summary: JoJo Siwa has confirmed her relationship with Chris Hughes has turned romantic.
story: JoJo Siwa has confirmed her relationship with Chris Hughes has turned romantic.
The two sparked dating rumors during their time on “Celebrity Big Brother UK." At the time, Siwa was in a relationship, which ended shortly after the cast left the Big Brother mansion.
Siwa, 22, told The Guardian her connection with Hughes, a 32-year-old former "Love Island" star, is “not platonic any more.”

“It’s not platonic any more, and it’s been a beautiful development, a beautiful connection, and I’m absolutely head over heels for him and he’s the same way,” Siwa said in an interview published Monday, June 2.
When asked if she has a message for anyone thinking the relationship is a “PR stunt,” Siwa told the publication, “Clearly, you’ve never been around us."

“I won’t ever speak for him, but for me personally, the happiness in my life just radiates off of me right now,” she continued. “Literally yesterday, I was massaging my cheeks; I’ve never (before) been in pain from smiling so much.”

The two became close friends on the reality competition show while she was still in a relationship with ex Kath Ebbs. After the series wrapped, Ebbs revealed in a since-deleted TikTok that Siwa ended their relationship at the show's April afterparty. Siwa then confirmed they were no longer together.
In the “Celebrity Big Brother” house, fans quickly noticed Siwa and Hughes’ natural chemistry, which she told The Guardian was “a very genuine connection — we’re not faking a thing.”
After leaving the house in late April, Siwa and Hughes remained inseparable, sharing pictures and videos together on social media, including playing game night with the singer's family.
But it's taken some time for the two to say whether their relationship was romantic.
In their first joint interview after the show's finale, Hughes described their connection at the time as a “soulmate friendship." Siwa agreed at the time, calling their relationship “platonic.”

In a carousel of photos posted to Instagram last month for her birthday, Siwa opened with a shot of her nuzzled into Hughes' neck with his hand on her thigh. He shared a similarly cozy black-and-white image last month, among other pictures together, writing, “The previous 7 days have been the prettiest...”
While confirming the romance, Siwa told The Guardian she understands why dating rumors have created such a buzz.
“People can see our chemistry, and they got to see it develop,” she said, later adding, “I think everyone’s just curious, and I can’t blame them.”
After previously coming out as a member of the LGBTQ+ community in 2021, Siwa said on “Celebrity Big Brother” that she prefers to describe herself as “queer” rather than “lesbian.”
On June 1, Siwa celebrated the start of Pride Month with a loving message on her Instagram story.
“Happy day 1 of the happiest month,” she began, adding a rainbow hue of hearts to represent the colors of the Pride flag.

“What I have learned over the last 22 years is that pride is all about love, acceptance, and celebration. No matter who you are or what you are, you are you, you are beautiful, and you are perfect,” she wrote at the time. “Everyone’s story is different and everyone’s journey is different.”
“The most beautiful thing about love is that it’s just love,” she continued. “Happy pride to the beautiful lgbtqia+ community, to the alias, and to all that exist :).”

title: Bethenny Frankel discusses her look at Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show: 'My body is natural'
summary: Bethenny Frankel addressed social media chatter about her appearance after the 2025 Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show.
story: Bethenny Frankel addressed social media chatter about her appearance after the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show.
The former “Real Housewives of New York City” star posted a video on Instagram on June 2 sharing more details about what it was like to walk in the runway show.
"I guess we have to discuss what I looked like on that runway, because the internet is so fascinated with my age, my weight, my face, my hair," she said.

Frankel, 54, wore several bathing suits during the runway event in Miami, including a one-piece swimsuit with cheetah print and pink bikini with black polka dots, plus a black mesh cover-up that she took off at one point.

"Listen, I can tell you with great certainty that every woman that was with me on that stage did not look that way two hours prior," Frankel said. "OK, it was everybody's job, and that's what goes on in Hollywood, in the entertainment industry, and the images that you and your daughters see of women, of Kim Kardashian, of Beyoncé, of J.Lo, of every famous person, that there is a lot of work that goes into that, a lot of glam, a lot of contouring, a lot of lighting, a lot."
Frankel added that she does not normally wear makeup, and that she doesn't crash diet.

"I don't go to a gym. I don't have a workout. I walk on the beach. Everything I do has balance. I self-regulate so I have a good relationship with food and exercise," she said. "It wasn't always that way. This is not that I have a good metabolism or just good genes, because I used to be 25 pounds heavier in my early 30s."
Frankel said she doesn't have issues with "food noise" or "exercise noise" at this point in her life.

"The reason my body is natural is because the exercise that I do, and have always done for my body is natural. I'll go months without exercise, and definitely days without doing anything, but I always come back to it," she said. "I have a good relationship with it, and I have a good relationship with food because it's the obsession, it's the extremes, it's the binging, it's the emotions, it's the noise. That is why we are struggling."
She concluded by telling her followers, "I want you to allow yourselves to have, but not beat yourselves up when you do indulge. And I want you to have a good relationship with food and exercise."
Frankel spoke more about her experience participating in the show in a June 1 Instagram post.

"There are so many things I could say about the Sports Illustrated experience. I didn't know much going into it. I mean, I know it's a magazine, and I know that once a year they do a swimsuit issue," she said.
"What I didn't know is what the culture is like there. And I didn't know who 90% of the women were. I will tell you that the resounding theme and culture is women supporting women," she continued.
Frankel said the women at the event were not just giving compliments, but asking about what people were planning to do during their walks and helping them with their ideas.

"I have to say that as much as the runway show was really fun ... I wasn't nervous. I was aware of my age. I was aware that I'm not a model, and there were a lot of models, and I was just like, 'Am I gonna stick this landing or make an absolute fool myself and embarrass you guys?'" she said.

In the caption of another Instagram post, she summarized the event: "This runway show was such an amazing experience and I am forever grateful to my community here in Florida and the people for your endless support."

title: Miley Cyrus gets candid about her stance on having kids
summary: Miley Cyrus shared her reasoning on if she was interested in becoming a parent, and fans loved her answer.
story: Miley Cyrus shared her reasoning on if she was interested in becoming a parent, and fans loved her answer.
Cyrus, 32, said she wasn't focused on having kids right now on the May 31 episode of "The Interview" podcast from The New York Times.

"It's not something I'm focused on," Cyrus said. "For being such an opinionated, sure person, this is a element in my life that I've always been pretty not super attached to, like a yes or no answer."
The "Flowers" singer referenced a conversation she had with her stepfather, Dominic Purcell, who married her mother, Tish Cyrus, in 2023.

"I was talking to my step dad, and he said, 'Why are you the only celebrity without a makeup line?' And I said, 'Because I'm not passionate about it.' He said, 'That's the right answer,'" she recalled.
Cyrus added that she feels the same way about motherhood.

"It's just never been something that I've been overly, you know, passionate about, and it's a lot of responsibility and it's a lot of devotion and energy," she said. "And I don't think, if you're not passionate about that, I don't know how you do sleepless nights and 18 years of what my mom dealt with."
She added: "And when I say 18 years, I mean 33 because I'm still a baby. So I've never felt the burn, you know, and I think for me, like, the burn is everything."
Cyrus' fans reacted to her comments on social media, with many expressing they felt similarly on the topic of children.
"Hearing this from Miley is so reassuring. I’m the same age as her. Motherhood is not for everyone," one person posted on X.
"miley has already mothered millions of girls and gays for the past 20 years….i think she’s good!" another person wrote on X.
"she’s already mother of music," an X user said.
Cyrus released her ninth studio album, "Something Beautiful," on May 30, and has long been open with her stance on having children.

In a 2019 interview with Elle, in the wake of the Woolsey Fire in 2018 that destroyed her home in Malibu, California, she said she didn't want to have children at the time because she knows the Earth "can't handle it."

“We’re getting handed a piece-of-s--- planet, and I refuse to hand that down to my child,” she said. “Until I feel like my kid would live on an earth with fish in the water, I’m not bringing in another person to deal with that.”

title: Country Star Lorrie Morgan's Husband Randy White Dies at 72 After Cancer Battle
summary: Country singer Lorrie Morgan shared that her husband of almost 15 years, Randy White, has died from mouth cancer.
story: Country singer Lorrie Morgan shared that her husband of almost 15 years, Randy White, has died from mouth cancer.

“Randy has been my partner, my champion and my rock for 17 years. Our big, wonderful family and I are devastated at the loss of this truly kind and incredible man. I was blessed by his love. Ran-Ran, I will love and miss you forever,” Morgan, a member of the Grand Ladies of the Opry, said in a statement shared with TODAY.com.
The couple married in September 2010 in a beachside wedding.

In 2024, Morgan announced that doctors had diagnosed White, a retired entrepreneur, with mouth cancer and that he was undergoing treatment. In April, the “Five Minutes” singer canceled concerts and events for two weeks when White was readmitted to a hospital, according to a statement at the time.

White, who owned a landscaping business, was born on May 15, 1953, according to People. Between Morgan’s two children and White’s four children, they couple shares 15 grandchildren and one great-grandchild with a second on the way, Morgan’s statement noted.
Morgan’s son, Jesse Keith Whitely, shared some memories of White on Facebook.

“I can say that the recent years of my life all the way back to when I was 22-23 years old this great man has been here and loved my mom, and also me & my sister as we were his own,” Whitely, also a country singer, wrote. “He has been the best grandfather for my kids they could ever ask for. … He has shown unconditional love to my mother and been the most gentle soul to ever grace this family. As we say our goodbyes, I reminisce of all the good times we have had & the battles he has helped me overcome.”

Mouth cancer can develop on the lips, gums, tongue, cheeks, roof or floor of the mouth and falls under the umbrella of head and neck cancer, according to the Mayo Clinic. Doctors treat it similarly to other head and neck cancers.
No final arrangements have been planned yet, the statement said.

title: Inside Read With Jenna's first ever book festival: Two days in Nashville and 200 book lovers
summary: Take a tour inside Read With Jenna's first ever book festival.
story: Jenna Bush Hager is overcome by emotion and admits she’s going to cry.

Standing on a stage at the W Nashville at 9 a.m., in front of navy-blue bookshelves created for this moment, Jenna reflects on six years of her book club. Or, as she puts it, “Read With Jenna is in kindergarten!”
The book club started as a dare to prove that people still read — the festival, which unfolded over May 30 and 31 and was sponsored by Nashville Music City, is proof that she was right.

Since Read With Jenna launched in 2019, Jenna has chosen 80 books and counting, with a focus on championing debut and diverse voices. Fifty books became bestsellers. And 15 of the club’s authors are in the room at the Read With Jenna Book Festival.
The first ever live gathering of Jenna’s book community and authors is the culmination of years of work. But it’s also the product of a lifetime.

Jenna, onstage, talks about the two grandmothers and mother whose love of reading molded her into the woman, and literary tastemaker, she is. She says Jenna Welch, her namesake, read to explore beyond her life in central Texas. Her grandmother Barbara Bush read for connection and enjoyed reading her granddaughters’ selections. Her mother, Laura Bush, a librarian, read for purpose.

You could say Jenna reads for all those reasons — plus, perhaps, change-making. In addition to bringing people together around her monthly picks, Jenna is starting her own imprint and having a hand in shaping books that go out into the world. (The first book, “Conform,” is out later this year.)

At the Read With Jenna Book Festival, audience members experienced the magic of books. While reading is a solitary act, Jenna believes a shared love of books, and the conversation they inspire, can bring people together.

On the morning of May 31, the room was full of about 200 readers from more than 35 states around the country — cities including Atlanta, Charleston, Chicago, Huntsville, Alabama and of course, Nashville.

Many attendees were friends, like an Elin Hilderbrand-loving duo who met in high school and Amy Sixbey and Cindy Hedges, who met at a yarn store they later co-owned. (Hedges and Sixbey, who are in multiple book clubs each, give advice for running one: Meet once a month and "read the book.")
Another woman gave an instant “yes” the moment her sister sent the event’s registration link.

Multiple sets of mothers and daughters at the festival said reading keeps them together even as their lives diverge. "We communicate through the books we read," Patti Grote of Chicago said, next to her grown daughter. "Bad on Paper" cohost and novelist Olivia Muenter got her mom tickets for Mother's Day.

Many came by themselves, like one woman who wore Read With Jenna merch she hand-bedazzled for the event — a jean jacket for the VIP event on Friday and another T-shirt for Saturday’s mainstage. When a 20-year-old couldn't find a friend to join her, she drove by herself.
The day began around 8 a.m. with breakfast and mingling. On the sunny terraces of the W Nashville overlooking Nashville's Gulch district, longtime friends sat side-by-side with solo travelers.

Before events started, and throughout the day, attendees stopped by the many vendors, picking charms to feature on bracelets from local store Charm Bar (cowboy hats and books were popular options), decorating book-shaped cookies from Butterfly Bakehouse, creating a bouquet from Amelia's Flowers, assembling bags of children's books for local libraries and getting their tarot cards read by Sarah Jane Chapman. They also perused pop-ups — Parnassus Books, the record store Groove and Shop TODAY.
The itinerary was stacked enough to impress a preteen. When Jenna called her eldest daughter Mila to describe the day, Mila responded, “Jenna, are you trying to make me jealous?”

Following breakfast came what could only be called a literary marathon. Stepping through the secret door in the bookcase were two bestselling authors, whose chats with Jenna will eventually feature on the Open Book with Jenna podcast.
First, Jenna spoke to “Tom Lake” author Ann Patchett about the nun who taught her to read, running a bookstore in Nashville and why she doesn’t have a cell phone.

Jenna also marveled at the full circle moment their conversation represented: At 18, Jenna and her twin Barbara Bush said Donna Tartt and Patchett were their favorite authors — and now, she was sitting on stage with Patchett. (Patchett said she and Tartt were chuffed by the Bush twins' answer at the time).

From the back of the room, the next speaker, Elin Hilderbrand looked on wearing a white dress that contrasted with her perpetual Nantucket tan. Hilderbrand took the stage after Patchett to discuss whether she’s really retiring, writing with her daughter and how, after 25 years, she’s ushering in a new era: Adaptations.

She and Jenna also shared some news: They are collaborating on a screen project — but, as Jenna said, "We can't share much." Hilderbrand's fans (“Hilderbabes," as they're called), will be delighted but not surprised to know that throughout the day of the festival, the best-selling author took breaks out by the pool.

From there, attendees shuffled between the day’s activities. There were interactive book club sessions with Read With Jenna authors Amity Gaige (“Heartwood”), Emma Straub (“All Adults Here”) and Christina Henriquez (“The Great Divide”), asking questions about the novels and answering questions about how they were personally moved.
Later came a chance to tap into their creative sides in workshops led by novelist Jessica Soffer (“This Is a Love Story”) and songwriter Eric Paslay.

After lunch, comedian Tiffany Haddish took the mainstage with Jenna. Haddish got deep, fast, about how her past trauma informs her comedy, and her revelations about her childhood in the foster care system inspired an attendee to share her own story.

One undeniable highlight came when Haddish “cursed” the audience with joy — “I curse you with all the joy and abundance and success you can handle. You deserve to be happy.” Another unplanned moment came when she and Paslay collaborated on a moving song about her.
The day rounded out with a celebration of what makes Read With Jenna so special: Its authors (who Jenna calls rock stars).

Jenna moderated a panel with multiple Read With Jenna authors (Coco Mellors, Rumaan Alam, Jean Kwok, Alison Espach, and Chris Whitaker, plus a cameo from Mellors’ son, Indigo). Then, lines formed for signings with all the authors in attendance, a list that included Cara Wall, Diane Marie Brown and Tara Stringfellow, too.

Almost 11 hours after the Read With Jenna Book Festival started at 8 a.m., the crowd gathered to listen to singer Blessing Offor perform. (Holly Williams performed with her husband during the VIP event — it's Music City, after all).
Jenna, overcome yet again, thanked attendees — and made, if not a firm promise, then the hope of one.
“Maybe we’ll make this an annual pilgrimage. Until then I hope you connect with us," she said.

title: Jason Sudeikis Closes Star-Studded Event With ‘Cheers’ Singalong Tribute for Uncle George Wendt
summary: Jason Sudeikis paid tribute at the Big Slick Celebrity Weekend in Kansas City, Missouri, to uncle and "Cheers" star George Wendt, who died in May.
story: Jason Sudeikis is speaking out about the death of his uncle George Wendt.

The “Cheers” star, who died last month at the age of 76, was honored over the weekend in Kansas City, Missouri, at the Big Slick Celebrity Weekend, an annual fundraiser event for Children’s Mercy that the actor took part in over the years.
“He was an amazing guy,” Sudeikis said during a panel discussion on May 30.

“With regard to my Uncle George, I mean, there’s that old saying of like, ‘Don’t meet your heroes,’ usually because they let you down, I assume, is the back half of that statement. But he’s not one of those people.”
Sudeikis said Wendt was a genuine and authentic person.
“He’s as fun and kind and as warm as any character he played on television or in films,” he said.

“He was an incredible influence to me, both as someone that blazed the trail, being from the Midwest and teaching me that acting was a career you could actually have, if you really care about it. And it’s also a career where you could meet the love of your life, like his wife, aka permanent girlfriend, Bernadette,” he continued, a reference to his wife, Bernadette Birkett.
The "Ted Lasso" star said Wendt never strayed far from where he came, using some of his own personal history to prep him for his role as beer-guzzling barfly Norm Peterson on “Cheers.”

“He also always kept connected to his family, to his roots, both in Chicago, of course, where he’s from, but then also the time he spent here, going to Rockhurst (University), and to a bar called Mike’s a whole bunch, where I think he logged maybe 18 credit hours,” he joked. “But it was all in preparation of a job that we all know him for, ‘Cheers.’ All time well spent. But, yeah, we miss him greatly, and I love him dearly.”
Paul Rudd was also on the panel and said Wendt would be missed at the Big Slick Celebrity Weekend.
“It’s going to be felt, his absence, this year, even though he’s so a part of it, just as much as any of us. He is a really, really sweet guy. I loved him,” he said.

Wendt got the ultimate tribute during the event on May 31 when the crowd in attendance sang the iconic “Cheers” theme to salute him. Sudeikis was seen onstage with Rudd, Heidi Gardner, Eric Stonestreet and a slew of others.

“To the one and only George Wendt, who couldn’t be with us this year,” the person introducing the song said. “But good lord, is he not. If you know the words, sing it. If you don’t, I think we put them on the board for you, but you probably know ‘em. Here we go. Let’s do it. Give it up for George.”
The crowd then sang along as the lyrics played on a screen.
Wendt earned six Emmy nominations for his portrayal of Norm. His death sparked an outpouring of tributes from his “Cheers” co-stars, as well as the show’s creators.

“George Wendt was as lovable as the character he played on ‘Cheers’. It was the perfect marriage of actor and character,” creators Glen Charles, Les Charles and James Burrows said in a statement to TODAY.

“George was a gentleman and a gentle man. Norm was America’s favorite barfly, and as the theme song said, everybody knew his name. And shouted it when he walked through the door. We were blessed to have him in our lives.”

title: Is the Late 'Duck Dynasty' Star Phil Robertson in the Reboot?
summary: Is Phil Robertson in the Duck Dynasty revival? here's what to know.
story: The highly anticipated reboot of “Duck Dynasty” premieres just days after Phil Robertson’s death.

On May 25, the Robertson family announced that Phil Robertson died at the age of 79. Prior to his death, the reality star encountered several health challenges, including a neurodegenerative disease and a blood disorder.

In January, A&E announced that the family would be returning to reality TV in a series titled “Duck Dynasty: The Revival” later this year. Their original series, “Duck Dynasty,” ran for 11 seasons on the network and followed the family as they ran their duck-hunting business, Duck Commander, in Louisiana and got into plenty of shenanigans at home.
As viewers prepare to get an update on the Robertson family's personal and professional lives, many are wondering if they'll catch one last glimpse of their patriarch, Phil Robertson.
Below, we're outlining everything you need to know.
Is Phil Robertson in the new 'Duck Dynasty' reboot?
Phil Robertson will not be in the new “Duck Dynasty” reboot.

Several members of the original cast will be featured in the revival series, however, including Willie Robertson and his wife, Korie Robertson. The couple’s children will also make appearances. “Other favorite family members” including Kay Robertson and Uncle Si are expected to be featured on the show.
How does 'Duck Dynasty: The Revival' address Phil's absence?

In the premiere episode of “Duck Dynasty: The Revival,” Korie and Willie Robertson share a conversation about the current stage of their lives, where they’re taking care of children, grandchildren and aging parents at the same time.
Korie Robertson reveals that Willie’s mother, Kay Robertson, doesn’t currently live on their property but visits often. She also addresses his father, Phil Robertson’s, health at the time.

“Recently, Willie’s dad was diagnosed with early Alzheimer’s and it’s been a struggle for all of us. I know he wouldn’t want to admit it, but I definitely think it’s affected Willie and I just think it’s made him think really hard about his own legacy,” she says in a confessional interview.
During their conversation, Korie Robertson asks her husband how he’s doing and he downplays things, saying, “I’m totally 100% fine.”
She then acknowledges that it’s “not very Robertson to talk about your feelings,” but tells her husband she’s “proud” of him for how he’s handling the stress.
What has the Robertson family said about Phil Robertson's death?
Following his death, Phil Robertson's family took to social media to pay tribute to his life. His granddaughter, Sadie Robertson, recalled a moment she shared with him before his death.

She started by posting the following Bible verse from the First Epistle to the Corinthians: “Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.”

Sadie Robertson went on to explain the significance of the verse, writing, “I was sitting with Papaw Phil today, I thought about this verse… he has already experienced this on earth — going from dead to alive by the power of Christ! It was his testimony that changed his life, our families life, and thousands of others. Now he is experiencing it in the fullness. Fully alive in Christ. The new has come.”
The reality star ended her post by sharing the following words from her grandfather: “One of the last things he said to me was ‘full strength ahead!’ Amen!”
After his death, Phil Robertson's family shared the following post on Facebook: “We celebrate today that our father, husband, and grandfather, Phil Robertson, is now with the Lord.”

title: Chris Hughes Shares Photos From ‘Game Night’ With JoJo Siwa’s Parents Amid Romance Rumors
summary: JoJo Siwa and Chris Hughes continue to fuel dating rumors, this time with a family-filled game night. See the photos.
story: JoJo Siwa and Chris Hughes continue to fuel dating rumors, this time with a family-filled game night.
On June 1, the “Love Island UK” alum shared a picture to his Instagram story of him playing a video game with JoJo Siwa’s dad, Tom Siwa.
“Spa and Dr Mario night with my boy,” he captioned the snap before adding a beer and smiley face emoji and tagging Tom Siwa.
Tom Siwa shared the post on his Instagram, too, and added another photo that seemingly showed him and Hughes toasting their beer bottles.

The same night, JoJo Siwa’s mom, Jessalynn Siwa, uploaded a clip to her Instagram story of her daughter rubbing Hughes’ neck and head while sitting on a couch together. Through laughter, JoJo Siwa then planted a kiss on Hughes’ head.
“Game Night,” her mom wrote beneath the video before tagging them and her husband.

In her next Instagram story, Jessalynn Siwa shared a picture of her daughter and Hughes sitting side by side in a booth at a restaurant as the singer showed him something on her phone. Jessalynn Siwa added the song “Summer Nights” from “Grease” to the post.
The family game night added to rumors swirling about JoJo Siwa and Hughes that first began when the two recently competed on “Celebrity Big Brother” 2025.

JoJo Siwa, 22, and Hughes, 32, met in the “Celebrity Big Brother” house and became close friends while she was in a relationship with former partner Kath Ebbs. Siwa came out as a member of the LGBTQ+ community in 2021. During her time on “Celebrity Big Brother,” however, she clarified that she prefers to describe herself as “queer” instead of “lesbian.”
On June 1, she celebrated Pride Month with a message on her Instagram story.
“Happy day 1 of the happiest month,” she began and included a series of different colored hearts to represent the Pride flag.

“What I have learned over the last 22 years is that pride is all about love, acceptance, and celebration. No matter who you are or what you are, you are you, you are beautiful, and you are perfect,” she wrote. “Everyone’s story is different and everyone’s journey is different.”
She continued, “The most beautiful thing about love is that it’s just love. Happy pride to the beautiful lgbtqia+ community, to the alias, and to all that exist :).”

After the “Celebrity Big Brother” finale in April, Ebbs revealed in a since-deleted TikTok that Siwa ended their relationship at the show’s after party. Siwa also confirmed they were no longer together.

Since leaving the house, JoJo Siwa and Hughes have been inseparable, sharing multiple posts of them together on social media. But while appearing together on British daytime talk show “This Morning,” Hughes described their connection as a “soul mate friendship.”
“That energy of where it’s not the standard energy you have with our friends — but we are friends,” he explained at the time.
JoJo Siwa agreed, saying their relationship was “platonic.” She also spoke about her breakup with Ebbs.

Fans have continued to wonder if there was more between the two reality television stars after JoJo Siwa uploaded a carousel of photos to celebrate her birthday last month. The slideshow featured multiple snaps of Hughes, including a couple of them cuddling as he placed his hand on her knee.

“This years birthday week was more magical than anything,” she said in the caption. “Full of surprises, family time, performing, chilling, laughing, loving, smiling, and good meaningful cries. Absolutely beautiful, wouldn’t change a single thing.”
She added, “A week I’ll remember for the rest of my life.”
He shared a series of photos with her, too. “The previous 7 days have been the prettiest..,” he captioned the post.

title: Remi Bader Posts Unedited Photos From Swimsuit Runway Show and Reflects On Health Journey
summary: Influencer Remi Bader is reflecting on her mental, emotional and physical health amid her Sports Illustrated Swimsuit runway debut.
story: Influencer Remi Bader is reflecting on her mental, emotional and physical health amid her Sports Illustrated Swimsuit runway debut.

The internet celebrity strutted down the catwalk for the magazine’s Swim Week fashion show May 31, posing first in a leopard print bikini and later returning in a blue bandana-style two piece and zebra-print hat.
Bader shared photos and videos from the milestone moment on her Instagram June 1 that showed her smiling wide and throwing her hands up in the air as she fully embraced the spotlight.
In the caption, she penned a “sappy long” statement about why the runway show was so meaningful after opening up about her weight loss and surgery.

“The past two months since I opened up about my surgery and everything I’ve been through mentally and physically over the past year and a half, I have been feeling quite a range of emotions,” she said. “Before I walked the runway last night, my dear friend, @noordinarynoire asked me how I was feeling — and I told her: not the way I thought I would.”
She said she was unsure who she would represent when she appeared on the catwalk because she doesn’t know where she fits in.
“I’m not plus size, I’m not skinny… I didn’t know what people wanted me to stand for and I didn’t like not having an answer,” she wrote.
During that instance of self-doubt, she recalled her friend offering some advice: “‘You don’t need to have (an answer).’” Her friend reminded her that she is “‘Remi f—ing Bader.”

“And in that moment, something finally clicked,” the TikToker wrote. “Since I started sharing my life online 5 years ago, I’ve constantly tried to figure out which box I belong in based on solely what others want me to be in and that has only been based on my appearance. But last night, I simply just stood for every girl or woman who’s felt lost about where she belongs, but still chooses to show up and put herself out there no matter what.”
She said that was all she needed to embody when she walked the runway.

Bader continued, “Looking at these unedited photos and not wishing to change a thing reminds me how far I’ve come — not for vanity, but for my mental, emotional, and physical health. To go from not knowing if I’d ever be able to walk out of my house again a year ago, to walking that runway confidently, smiling, and not thinking twice about what anyone else saw, but how good I FELT — and that’s something I’ll never take for granted.”
To conclude, she expressed her gratitude to Sports Illustrated Swimsuit for asking her to participate.
“And sorry (but very much not sorry) for the long caption,” she cheekily added and included a white heart.

As she mentioned in her post, Bader has opened up in the past about her health journey. In March, she revealed in an interview with Self magazine that she underwent a weight loss surgery called single anastomosis duodenal-ileal bypass (SADI-S) in December 2023. The procedure is a hybrid of gastric sleeve and gastric bypass.
She described the recovery process as “the most brutal thing.”

“I was in recovery hours, hours, hours, hours, throwing up. It was not normal,” she explained. “I was supposed to leave (the hospital) in one day. I could not stop projectile vomiting, and I couldn’t drink water. They won’t let you leave if you can’t drink water. I actually can’t explain how horrible it was.”
Bader continued to struggle as she recovered. She shared that she fell into a “deep depression” that was “the scariest time of my life.”
But, she said later in the interview that she has improved.

“Am I happy overall right now, happier than when I was dealing with the health issues and the back pain and all those things? Yes. I have more energy. All of my health stuff went back to normal after years and years and years,” she said at the time.

She added, “I think I’ve let so many people take my power away for a long time. I will never regret having my time to heal, and I’m still healing and figuring it out. ... That was none of the internet’s business—these people that don’t know me—and that was for me to figure out.”

title: The Robertson Family Returns Tonight in ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival.’ Here's How to Watch
summary: What better way to kick off summer than with a “Duck Dynasty” reboot? Here's how to watch  ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival’ and what to know about the new series.
story: What better way to kick off summer than with a “Duck Dynasty” reboot?
Eight years after wrapping the popular A&E series, “Duck Dynasty: The Revival” brings the next generation of Robertsons to reality television this June.
The spinoff once again follows the duck-hunting Robertson family as they navigate life, business and their legacy in Louisiana — now introducing a new generation of great grandchildren.
“Duck Dynasty” first aired in 2012 and ran for 11 seasons until 2017, when the Robertsons “decided to end the series to focus on other ventures,” per A&E.

The original show focused on late family patriarch Phil Robertson, his wife, Kay Robertson, and the couple's extended Southern family. The revival, however, puts their son, Willie Robertson, and his wife, Korie Robertson, at the center, while continuing to feature the rest of the family.
Phil Robertson died at 79, his family announced May 25. The family did not immediately reveal a cause of death.
Read on to learn all about “Duck Dynasty: The Revival” and how to watch the series.
When Does ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival’ Premiere?
The first episode of “Duck Dynasty: The Revival” premieres Sunday, June 1 at 9 p.m. ET.
What Channel Will Air ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival’?
All Season 1 episodes of “Duck Dynasty: The Revival” will air live on A&E.
The network carried the original “Duck Dynasty” series for 11 seasons from 2012 to 2017.
How to Watch ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival’ Without Cable
Each episode of “Duck Dynasty: The Revival” will be available to stream on the A&E app the day after it airs live.
In order to watch the show through the app, however, users must sign in using a television provider. At this time, the platform does not offer the option for a standalone subscription.

Other services, such as Philo, Frndly and Fubo, will have the show episodes available to stream and watch online if you have an account or set one up. Most of these platforms have a free trial for new users who sign up.
What Is ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival’ About?
“Duck Dynasty: The Revival” will center around Willie Robertson, the son of late family patriarch Phil Robertson and matriarch Kay Robinson, and his wife, Korie Robertson, per A&E.

Similar to the original series, the spinoff will follow the Robertsons’ lives in West Monroe, Louisiana, operating their duck-hunting business, Duck Commander. The new show watches the kids navigate marriage and growing families, introducing a new generation of grandchildren to continue the Robertson legacy.
Who Will Appear on ‘Duck Dynasty: The Revival’?
Aside from Willie and Korie Robertson, Kay Robertson and Uncle Si, the brother of late Phil Robertson, will appear in “Duck Dynasty: The Revival,” according to A&E.
The network says the reboot will also feature the beloved children of the Robertson family, John Luke, Sadie, Will, Bella and Rebecca, as well as their families.

In 2020, after the original series wrapped, Phil Robertson revealed that he had reunited with a long-lost daughter, Phyliss, from an affair he had in the 1970s. At this time, it's not clear if Phyliss will be on the new show.

title: 'Stranger Things' Finally Gets Release Date for Highly Anticipated Fifth and Final Season
summary: "Stranger Things" Season Five is coming later this year, Netflix announced at Tudum.
story: It's almost time to return to Hawkins, Indiana, for a fifth and final time.
“Stranger Things” Season 5 is dropping on Netflix in three parts this fall, the streaming platform announced at its fan event, Tudum, May 31.

The first part of Season 5, which will have four episodes, will be released on Nov. 26. The second part, containing three episodes, will be available on Christmas Day, Dec. 25. And the final episode will be released on New Year's Eve, Dec. 31. Each “Stranger Things” volume will be available at 8 p.m. ET.

Season 5’s official release date comes more than three years after Season 4 first premiered in two installments. The first seven episodes dropped in May 2022, followed by two supersized episodes in July. The Season 4 finale, titled “The Piggyback,” clocked in at a whooping 2 hours, 30 minutes.
Season 5 is so far known to have eight episodes, with the following titles:
“The Crawl”
“The Vanishing of …”
“The Turnbow Trap”
“Sorcerer”
“Shock Jock”
“Escape from Camazotz”
“The Bridge”
“The Rightside Up”
When “Stranger Things” co-creators Matt and Ross Duffer shared in 2022 that Season 4 would air in two volumes, they also confirmed that the show, which premiered in 2016, would end with Season 5.
At the time, they called the events of Season 4 — which introduced the series’ true big bad, the humanoid psychokinetic being Vecna — “the beginning of the end.”

Season 4 ended with the reveal that Vecna (played by Jamie Campbell Bower) is responsible for the alternate dimension known as the Upside Down being as terrifying as it is. All along, he was the brain behind each monster, such as Season 2’s Mind-Flayer.
In the explosive finale, Vecna nearly kills Max (Sadie Sink) and briefly stops her heart, connecting Hawkins even more closely to the Upside Down.
The final scene sees everyone’s favorite motley crew realize that the Upside Down is actively invading their world, setting the stage for the final battle to be back in Hawkins, where it all began.

The cast of “Stranger Things” Season 5 is consistent with past installments. Millie Bobby Brown, who was just 11 when she was cast as Eleven and is now 21, as well as Finn Wolfhard, Sadie Sink, Caleb McLaughlin, Gaten Matarazzo and Noah Schnapp are all confirmed for Season 5.
Leads Winona Ryder and David Harbour also appear in photos from production, as well as Cara Buono, Charlie Heaton, Joe Keery, Natalia Dyer, Maya Hawke and Priah Ferguson.
Netflix announced in 2023 that “Terminator” star Linda Hamilton would join the show for the fifth season.
Filming for “Stranger Things” Season 5 occurred throughout 2024 and wrapped Dec. 20 of that year, after initial delays due to the writers’ and actors’ strike.

title: Patti LuPone Apologizes Over Recent Comments About Audra McDonald and Kecia Lewis
summary: What's going on between Patti LuPone and Audra McDonald? LuPone apologized May 31 after she said in a recent interview that McDonald is "not a friend."
story: Patti LuPone has apologized over recent comments she made to the New Yorker, which included questioning Broadway star Kecia Lewis’ theater credits and stating that Audra McDonald is “not a friend.”

LuPone and McDonald’s names have appeared together in headlines ever since McDonald appeared to support Lewis’ “open letter” Instagram video calling out LuPone’s behavior last November. In her video, Lewis blasted LuPone, calling her “racially microaggressive” after the three-time Tony Award winner complained about the sound level of the Alicia Keys Broadway musical “Hell’s Kitchen.”

In the New Yorker article, LuPone discussed the social media incident with Lewis and questioned the “Hell’s Kitchen” star referring to herself as a Broadway “veteran.” She also reacted to McDonald’s support of Lewis, saying she “should know better.”
Her comments received widespread backlash, including via an open letter from the Broadway community that dubbed her statements “bullying,” “harassment” and “racialized disrespect.”
In a statement May 31, LuPone apologized and called her comments to the New Yorker about Lewis “demeaning and disrespectful.”
“I hope to have the chance to speak to Audra and Kecia personally to offer my sincere apologies,” LuPone said in the statement.
McDonald, for her part, reacted to LuPone’s interview quotes in a recent interview for “CBS Sunday Mornings” and said, “If there’s a rift between us, I don’t know what it is.”
If the ongoing feud rumors between LuPone and McDonald all sound, well, dramatic, they are. Read on for more of the story.
What Started the Tension Between Audra McDonald and Patti LuPone?

LuPone and McDonald have known each other for decades. The two veteran actors have shared the stage several times, most notably performing together in the New York Philharmonic’s concert version of “Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street” in 2000, and in the LA Opera production of “Rise and Fall of the City of Mahagonny” in 2007.

But tensions seemingly flared, for LuPone at least, after she noted that six-time Tony winner McDonald posted since-deleted emoji comments in support of the Instagram video Kecia Lewis posted criticizing LuPone in November 2024.

Lewis, who won a Tony Award for playing a piano teacher in “Hell’s Kitchen,” blasted LuPone for complaining about the noise level of “Hell’s Kitchen,” which played next door to LuPone’s two-woman play with Mia Farrow, “The Roommate.”
“These actions, in my opinion, are bullying, they’re offensive, they are racially microaggressive, they’re rude, they’re rooted in privilege,” said Lewis.
“Referring to a predominantly Black Broadway show as loud can unintentionally reinforce harmful stereotypes,” she added.
McDonald responded to Lewis' video by posting emoji of hearts and hands clapping, People reported at the time.
What Did Patti LuPone Say About Audra McDonald's Emoji Comments?
When The New Yorker asked LuPone if she was surprised by McDonald’s comments, LuPone responded, “That’s typical of Audra. She’s not a friend.”
She added that when she saw McDonald’s emoji, she thought, “‘You should know better.’”
LuPone also mentioned that she and McDonald had had a rift in the past but did not elaborate further.

LuPone also responded negatively when The New Yorker asked her opinion on McDonald’s recent Tony Award nomination for playing Rose in the current revival of “Gypsy,” a role for which LuPone previously won the award in 2008.
LuPone reportedly stared at him “in silence” for fifteen seconds.
“Then she turned to the window and sighed, ‘What a beautiful day,’” the reporter wrote.
How Patti LuPone Responded to Kecia Lewis' Video About Noise Complaints

As for the sound problems between the two theaters, LuPone told The New Yorker that she was advised by the stage manager of “The Roommate” to ask the theater company for help to stop the noise from “Hell’s Kitchen” from bleeding through the walls.
When the noise issue was resolved, she said, she sent flowers to thank the company.
“This is not unusual on Broadway. This happens all the time when walls are shared,” she explained.
While speaking to The New Yorker, LuPone objected to Lewis saying in her video that she was speaking as one theater “veteran” to another.
“Here’s the problem. She calls herself a veteran? Let’s find out how many Broadway shows Kecia Lewis has done, because she doesn’t know what the f--- she’s talking about," said LuPone.
How Did Audra McDonald Respond to Patti LuPone's Comments?
McDonald responded to LuPone's comments about the alleged beef between them during an interview with Gayle King that will air on the June 1 edition of “CBS Sunday Mornings."
“If there’s a rift between us, I don’t know what it is,” McDonald told King in a preview video of the interview shared to Instagram.

“That’s something you’d have to ask Patti about. You know, I haven’t seen her in about 11 years just because we’ve been busy just with life. So I don’t know what rift she’s talking about, but you’d have to ask her,” she added.
LuPone's comments were widely censured in an open letter from the Broadway community, which received more than 600 signatures as of May 31.

The letter was addressed to the The American Theatre Wing and The Broadway League and stated, “Individuals, including Patti Lupone, who use their platform to publicly demean, harass, or disparage fellow artists — particularly with racial, gendered, or otherwise violent language — should not be welcomed at industry events, including the Tony Awards, fundraisers, and public programs.”
The Tony Awards are set for June 8, and the two groups responsible for hosting the show did not immediately respond to NBC News’ request for comment May 31.
Did Patti LuPone apologize?
Yes, LuPone apologized for her comments to the New Yorker via an Instagram statement May 31.
“For as long as I have worked in the theatre, I have spoken my mind and never apologized. That is changing today,” she began.
She said she regrets her "flippant and emotional responses" during the interview, calling them "inappropriate."

Addressing the open letter, she said she “wholeheartedly” agrees with the sentiments expressed, writing, “theatre has always been about lifting each other up and welcoming those who feel they don’t belong anywhere else.”
“I made a mistake, I take full responsibility for it, and I am committed to making this right,” she said. “Our entire theatre community deserves better.”

title: How to Watch Netflix Fan Event Tudum, Featuring Cast of 'Stranger Things,' 'Wednesday,' Lady Gaga and More
summary: Netflix Tudum 2025: The Live Event premieres on the streaming platform May 31, 2025, at 8 p.m. ET.
story: Netflix is bringing back its signature live event this weekend, giving fans a sneak peek into what’s to come on the streaming platform.
Netflix Tudum 2025: The Live Event is set to take place on Saturday, May 31, 2025, at the Kia Forum in Los Angeles.
The event will be hosted by actor Sofia Carson and will include “can’t-miss performances, jaw-dropping reveals, and unforgettable moments,” per the streaming platform.

The first live fan event from Netflix dates back to January 2020, with the streaming platform bringing Tudum to São Paulo, Brazil, per a release from Netflix. The event was billed as a “multi-title festival that celebrated Netflix’s young adult content,” which brought in more than 50,000 fans over the course of four days.

Over the years, the event has continued to develop and gain traction, bringing in some of the streaming giant’s biggest stars to celebrate the occasion, including Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson, Adam Sandler and Charlize Theron in the past.
This year will notably bring together the stars of the platforms top original content, including "Stranger Things," "Ginny & Georgia" and more.
Here’s everything to know about Netflix Tudum 2025, including how to watch live and what to expect from the fan event.
What Is Tudum?
Tudum is both a live event and Netflix's official website for news and fan content. Tudum notably gets its name from the sound that plays at the beginning of each Netflix movie and series.

According to Netflix, Netflix Tudum 2025 will be the “ultimate fan celebration” with a variety of entertainment, including cameos from stars, surprise premieres of the platform's titles and live performances.
How To Watch Netflix Tudum 2025
Netflix Tudum 2025: The Live Event is set to premiere at 8 p.m. ET on Saturday, May 31, 2025.
The event will be available for viewers to stream on the platform to tune into the action and catch exclusive reveals along the way.
Who Will Be Featured in Netflix Tudum 2025?
Sofia Carson, who has starred in Netflix hits including “The Life List” and “Purple Hearts,” will host this year’s show.
Fans will also be treated with performances from Lady Gaga and Hanumankind, a rising hip-hop star from India.

The event is slated to include various special guest stars throughout the evening, including Ben Affleck and Matt Damon from “The Rip,” as well as Millie Bobby Brown, Gaten Matarazzo, Caleb McLaughlin, Noah Schnapp and Finn Wolfhard from “Stranger Things.”

Other Netflix stars will also appear, including Madison Bailey, Chase Stokes and Drew Starkey from “Outer Banks,” Lily Collins from “Emily in Paris,” Jenna Ortega, Luis Guzmán and Fred Armisen from “Wednesday,” Nikki Rodriguez and Noah LaLonde from “My Life with the Walter Boys,” and many more.
Which Shows Will Get Sneak Previews at Netflix Tudum 2025?

In addition to performances from Lady Gaga and Hanumankind, the live event will also debut exclusive sneak previews from some of the most highly anticipated movies and series on the streaming platform, including “Happy Gilmore 2,” “Frankenstein,” “Stranger Things,” “Wednesday,” “Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery,” “Squid Game,” and more.
Additionally, the event promises “epic crossover moments” with stars from “Outer Banks,” “America’s Sweethearts: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders,” “Ginny & Georgia,” and other titles.

title: Robin Thicke Marries Longtime Fiancée April Love Geary After 6-Year Engagement. See the Pics
summary: Robin Thicke and his longtime fiancée, April Love Geary, got married after being engaged for 6 years. See all the best photos from their nuptials!
story: Robin Thicke and his longtime fiancée, April Love Geary, are married!
On May 30, Geary shared intimate moments of her and Thicke's wedding day via her Instagram Stories after she previously shared a carousel of pics earlier that week of her embracing Thicke in France.
"It’s wedding week 💒 💍 👰🏽‍♀️," she had captioned the pics.

On her Instagram Stories, Geary reshared videos and photos that her wedding guests took during her nuptials, including a candid moment of Geary beaming in her wedding dress as Thicke appeared to give a speech during the ceremony.
In a sweet video, which Geary posted to her Instagram Story, the newlyweds are seen dancing as Thicke sings one of his songs.
Geary’s guests also captured her walking down the aisle in a beautiful all-white fitted dress and what appeared to be a lace veil.
Then in another sweet video Geary reshared, Thicke is seen holding their 4-year-old son, Luca’s hand. At their wedding, Luca acted as the ring bearer aka "ring security."
Judging by the clips, the couple and guests in attendance seemed to have an amazing time.

Less than a week before they tied the knot, Thicke re-proposed to Geary in Cannes. This was the second time the "Blurred Lines" singer got down on one knee to ask his girlfriend to be his wife. The first time he did it was in 2018 on Christmas Eve — and Geary said "yes" back then too.

"Robin surprised me during our trip to Cannes by proposing to me again with a new ring that one of my best friends @nikkiwhatnikkiwho @establishedjewelry made, I’m so obsessed with it, thank you!!!😭" she wrote on Instagram. "This trip was such a dream. 🤍."
"I love you so much @robinthicke. Also a huge thank you to @alilasky for clearing out the whole area and making sure there wasn’t a single person getting in the way 😂," she added.
Thicke was previously married to actor Paula Patton from 2005 to 2015. Then in 2016, Thicke got matching tattoos with Geary to celebrate their 2-year anniversary.

title: Valerie Mahaffey of ‘Northern Exposure' and ‘Desperate Housewives’ Dies at 71
summary: Valerie Mahaffey, known for playing Eve in the '90s TV series "Northern Exposure," has died. She was 71.
story: Valerie Mahaffey, known for playing Eve in the '90s TV series "Northern Exposure," has died. She was 71.
The Emmy-winning actor died after a battle with cancer, her publicist confirmed in a statement.

In addition to starring in "Northern Exposure," Mahaffey is known for playing Bitsy in Adam Sandler's film "Jack and Jill" and Annie in 2003's "Seabiscuit." She also made notable appearances in shows like "Grey's Anatomy" and "Desperate Housewives."
Mahaffey was born in Indonesia in 1953. She went on to live in Nigeria, England, Canada and Texas. She is survived by husband Joseph Kell and her daughter, Alice Richards.
“I have lost the love of my life, and America has lost one of its most endearing actresses," Kell said in a statement to TODAY.com. "She will be missed."

Mahaffey began acting in the ‘70s when she booked the role of Catherine Howard in the Broadway musical “Rex.” While in New York City, she also took the stage for productions including “Dracula” and “Fearless Frank.” In 1977, she secured a small screen role in the TV movie “Tell Me My Name” before she played Ashley Bennett in the soap opera “The Doctors.”
That role earned Mahaffey her a Daytime Emmy nomination in 1980. She took home her first Emmy in 1992, winning outstanding supporting actress in a drama series for her work in "Northern Exposure."
On X, fans mourned her death and celebrated her past performances.
"Very tragic. So sad. Amazing fun actress. Watch her in French Exit," one account said.
Another wrote, "O Valerie Mahaffey thank you for giving us good cinematic moments RIP."

title: What Happens at the End of ‘Mountainhead’? Jason Schwartzman Explains That Twist
summary: "Mountainhead" star Jason Schwartzman tells TODAY.com about the ending of the new HBO movie, also starring Steve Carell, Ramy Youssef and Cory Michael Smith.
story: Four billionaire tech bros gather at a mountain mansion for a weekend retreat. What could go wrong?

In “Mountainhead,” the new HBO dark comedy film from “Succession” creator Jesse Armstrong premiering May 31, almost everything manages to go completely off the walls when men behind the country’s largest tech companies get together for the weekend.

The star-studded cast features Steve Carell, Ramy Youssef, Jason Schwartzman and Cory Michael Smith as the tech CEOs gathering at Venis' (Smith) titular mansion for a getaway with the boys, or self-proclaimed “brewsters.”
Arriving at Mountainhead, the group discovers Venis' social media app has a new artificial intelligence algorithm that incites riots across the world.
But instead of navigating the global crisis and potential collapse of civilization, the four “brewsters” enjoy sliders, beers and bowling as they revel in their riches.

However, when Jeff (Youssef) raises questions about the effects of Venis’ company, the dynamic quickly devolves into a three-against-one matchup that goes so off the rails that even one of the satire's stars couldn’t believe the twist that comes next.
Schwartzman, who plays Hugo, also known as “Soups,” tells TODAY.com about the moment he was reading the script for the first time and trying to piece it together.

“Before that happened in the script, if you were to pause it and say, ‘Now, what do you think happens?’ That would have been one of the last things I would have thought,” he says. “That’s what’s so beautiful about it — it’s heading in one direction, and then it really just becomes a whole different animal.”
Here’s what to know about the unexpected twist in “Mountainhead,” and what happens to Venis, Jeff, Hugo and Randall.
What Is the Twist in 'Mountainhead'?

While there's some lighthearted animosity between the four CEOs, the weekend seems to be off to a regular start — full of brews, hiking through the snow and, of course, talk of taking over several different countries.

But when Jeff confronts Randall, played by Carell, about the implications of Venis’ new AI feature — and suggests they take steps to replace Venis as head of the company — the dynamic quickly changes.
Devising a grander plan, Randall grabs Hugo out of a virtual meeting and says plainly, “I think we need to come up with a plan to kill Jeff.”
“Sorry, what the f---?” Hugo replies.
Schwartzman tells TODAY.com the shift to the murder plot completely surprised him while reading the script.

“It becomes, in an odd way, to me, more serious, because we’re talking about murder, but also there’s the more overtly slapstick comedy parts of the movie too,” he says. “It’s an interesting shift, and it was so fun.”
Randall clarifies that they need to come up with a plan to remove Jeff from power — or proposes that, maybe, they should actually kill him because he wants to sell Venis out.
Hugo suggests they could just talk to Jeff, but Randall says the “four sigma IQ” move is to just kill him.
“Man, I wanted us to have a really nice weekend! Now we’re going to kill Jeff?” Hugo says, obviously pained by the developments.
The pair then fill Venis in on their plan and reveal that Jeff is planning to get the board of directors to push him out of the company.
“You are f------- kidding,” Venis replies, shocked.
After further debate, the three agree to kill Jeff and begin plotting how they could take him out without facing any consequences — even floating a presidential “pre-pardon.”
Speaking about the nearly nonsensical lingo used by the AI tech elites, Schwartzman tells TODAY.com, “It’s so funny, because that is the vernacular. It’s like a whole different culture.”
“I mean, it takes a long time to put it together,” he continues. “Once you know it, that’s it, but it’s truly a kind of a different language.”
Does Jeff Die in 'Mountainhead'?

Ultimately, Randall, Venis and Hugo confront Jeff while he's leaning against a staircase talking about Hugo’s new “mediation superapp,” Slowzo. During the encounter, Hugo runs up from behind and pushes him, but Jeff catches himself before falling.
Jeff insists the shove could have killed him, but Hugo tells him the push was just a joke. As Jeff retreats to bed for the night, the trio regroups and decides to try smothering him with a pillow.
They sneak into Jeff's room and Hugo puts the pillow over Jeff's head while Venis grabs his legs. But after a few moments, Randall points out that it's likely a breathable pillow.

Randall then grabs a bowling ball and drops it on Jeff, but Jeff still kicks and grunts under the pillow and covers. Jeff manages to escape and figures out the murder plot isn't a joke. He tells Venis, Hugo and Randall that he wants to negotiate.

They chase Jeff into the bathroom and talk, as Hugo threateningly holds a golf club. Jeff manages to get away, but Hugo pulls out his phone and locks down the entire house with the touch of his finger using his security app.

The trio splits off to find Jeff, ultimately locking him in a sauna. Jeff begs them to let him negotiate, but they double down on their plan and start pouring gasoline on the door and sweeping it into the sauna.

When they pull out a lighter, Jeff freaks out and writes out a deal. Leaving Jeff in the sauna to discuss the agreement, attorneys and public relations professionals then flood the house to work overnight composing the deal.
As daybreak hits, Randall, Hugo and Venis are eating breakfast and get notifications that their deal has been signed.
The arrangement makes Hugo, who actually was only a centi-millioniare, an official billionaire and ensures Venis and Randall are safe in their positions at their companies.

But the group fears they could have to face Jeff again. So, Hugo asks one of his staff members to show him to his car. Instead, Jeff comes out to the kitchen, where he chugs almost an entire carton of milk.
“Just feeling a little dry,” Jeff tells the trio.
Hugo responds saying they sent Evian waters down overnight and asks if he got them.
“I did. Nevertheless, I’m a little dehydrated from my night in the sauna,” Jeff says.
They lightly offer him a smoothie, but Jeff is still processing their attempted murder, saying what happened the night before will stick with him for a long time.
Still, Jeff gives Randall, Venis and Hugo the gift he originally brought for them — the “brewester brew,” or bottles of Kentucky-Japanese whiskey.

As the four prepare to leave, Jeff gets in his car and Venis knocks on the window. When Jeff gets out, Venis tells him the plot was Randall’s idea and floats the notion of putting Randall “out to pasture,” attempting to create a new deal directly with Jeff.
Jeff nods in acknowledgement, but says Randall would come for everything in the end.
“That’s what makes it exciting,” Venis responds with a grin.

Randall then walks out of the house to see the pair talking and asks if everything is all right. When they confirm all is well, Randall gets in his own car and turns around to see the two hugging. As the car drives away, Randall looks on the verge of tears.

As Venis flies away from the mansion in a helicopter, Hugo is left alone on the balcony. He pulls out his phone and looks at a few clips of riots, before opening Slowzo and starting a guided meditation.

title: Taylor Swift Celebrates Purchase of Masters by Re-Creating This Viral Moment With Jack Antonoff
summary: Taylor Swift re-created a viral moment with producer and friend Jack Antonoff to celebrate the purchase of her master recordings.
story: Taylor Swift is enjoying her “Reputation” era again after breaking the news that she now owns her master recordings.

Swift announced in a May 30 letter on her website that after re-recording four of her albums — dubbed “Taylor’s Version” — she bought back all of her masters, including her 2006 self-titled debut and 2017’s “Reputation.”
Swift’s longtime friend and producer, Jack Antonoff, shared a video of the duo on X the night of May 30 as they enjoyed a “guilt free” listen of “Reputation” to celebrate the news.

In the clip, Swift and Antonoff sang the album’s ninth track, “Getaway Car” and re-created a viral moment from her 2020 documentary “Miss Americana” where they wrote the song together. Swift was initially carrying her cat Meredith at the start of the video before placing the feline down to finish the tune with Antonoff, who screamed as the clip ended.
“rep forever guilt free listening!” Antonoff captioned the post.

After re-recording four of her albums, including “Fearless,” “Speak Now,” “Red” and “1989,” Swift addressed in her May 30 letter to fans whether she would be re-releasing the rest of her first six albums to complete the project.

“What about Rep TV? Full transparency: I haven’t even re-recorded a quarter of it,” Swift wrote on her website. “The Reputation album was so specific to that time in my life, and I kept hitting a stopping point when I tried to remake it…To be perfectly honest, it’s the one album in those first 6 that I thought couldn’t be improved upon by redoing it. Not the music, or the photos, or the videos. So I kept putting it off.”
However, Swift shared, “I’ve already completely re-recorded my entire debut album, and I really love how it sounds now.”

Whether fans will get to hear “Taylor’s Version” of those two albums — or even just the vault tracks — remains unknown, with the singer writing, “But if it happens, it won’t be from a place of sadness and longing for what I wish I could have. It will just be a celebration now.”

After working with Swift on several tracks from 2014’s “1989,” Antonoff and Swift kicked off a long partnership of co-writing and producing her subsequent albums, including “Reputation,” “Lover,” “Folklore,” “Evermore,” “Midnights” and several songs on her most recent record, “The Tortured Poets Department.”

During an October 2023 appearance on “Sunday Sitdown with Willie Geist,” Antonoff opened up about his friendship and working relationship with Swift over the decades, including why he thinks they work so well together.

“That relationship has gone on and on and on and I think we’ve just pushed each other endlessly,” Antonoff explained. “I could quantify our relationship in very reductive ways about the things we agree on, the sounds we like, but the truth is, we’ve just grown together. She’s put an amazing amount of belief in me.”

title: Hoda Used a Plastic Container Instead of a Bag at an Event — With a Note From Daughter Haley
summary: Instead of a purse, Hoda Kotb brought a plastic bin to her Joy 101 launch party. It held her phone and additional belongings for the evening.
story: Hoda Kotb has never been one to follow the crowd when it comes to accessorizing — and she isn’t starting now.
While Hoda hit the red carpet at her New York City launch party for her new wellness venture, Joy 101, she ditched a purse for a plastic container that held her phone and other miscellaneous items.
It wasn’t just any old plastic bin, though, but one that was adorned with a loving message by her oldest daughter: “Phone bin made by Haley the rockstar.”
The former TODAY anchor’s assistant, Sophia Ungaro, said that this isn’t the first time the “phone bin” has made an appearance — as a matter of fact, the container is a daily wellness habit for her.
“Ninety percent of her day, her phone is in the bin. She really only checks it if she knows that she’s getting a call. She’ll be able to hear that through,” Ungaro told TODAY.com at the launch event.
Hoda utilizes the phone bin so she can focus on what she needs to get done that day and push distractions to the wayside, Ungaro explained.

“She likes to have it in here because it helps her zero in on her inbox ... when she has her phone in her bin, she’s more focused. It’s more strategy-based, what she’s responding to and what she’s looking at,” she said.
However, Hoda doesn’t use the plastic bin for just work-related priorities, and her daugher Haley makes sure of that.
“(Haley) was like, ‘Mom? Why is your phone not in the bin.’ Like, it’s family time,” her assistant said.
Outside of her phone, Hoda uses the container to carry around anything from gummies to a phone charger — and a note from Haley and her youngest daughter, Hope.
“It’s very varied, but it’s always very based on what she needs for the day,” Ungaro said.

Hoda’s phone bin is the latest example of an unconventional accessory she’s brought to an event; she’s been spotted with other purse alternatives, like a Ziploc bag and camera case, at past functions.

title: Scooter Braun Reacts to Taylor Swift Buying Master Recordings Of Her Music
summary: Scooter Braun responds to Taylor Swift's announcement that she purchased her master recordings.
story: Scooter Braun, the businessman responsible for Taylor Swift rerecording and releasing four of her early albums as "Taylor's Versions," says he's glad Swift now finally owns the master recordings of all of her music.
“I am happy for her,” Braun, 43, told TODAY.com May 30 after Swift announced she purchased the rights to the master recordings of her entire discography.
Swift broke her news in a letter to fans May 30 on her website.“All of the music I’ve ever made... now belongs... to me,” she wrote.

“To say this is my greatest dream come true is actually being pretty reserved about it. To my fans, you know how important this has been to me — so much so that I meticulously re-recorded and released 4 of my albums, calling them Taylor’s Version.”

In her letter, Swift thanked fans for purchasing her "Taylor's Version" albums along with tickets to her record-breaking "Eras Tour," explaining that their "passionate support" was "why I was able to buy back my music."
"I can’t thank you enough for helping to reunite me with this art that I have dedicated my life to, but have never owned until now," she wrote.
The controversy around the rights to Swift’s music began in 2019 when music executive Braun bought Swift’s former record label Big Machine Records.
The purchase made Braun the owner of all master recordings for Swift’s first six albums. The following year, the recordings were sold to the private equity firm Shamrock Capital.

In a 2020 statement reacting to the Shamrock Capital sale, Swift said at the time she “attempted to enter into negotiations with Scooter Braun” but alleges she was asked to sign an NDA that would “silence” her.
Braun told Variety in 2021 that he offered to sell Swift's catalog back to her, "but her team refused."
Swift, who signed her record deal with Big Machine Records when she was just 15, announced in November 2020 that she had begun rerecording her first six albums.

Over the years, she's released four of the re-recordings — “Fearless” (2021), “Red” (2021), “Speak Now” (2023) and “1989” (2023) — all with the phrase “Taylor’s Version” added to their titles to reflect that she owned the master recordings of the new versions.
Prior to her May 30 announcement about buying back her music, Swift still had two additional pre-2019 albums left to rerecord and release:  2017's “Reputation” and her 2006 self-titled debut album.
Swift addressed the two albums in her letter to fans, explaining that she already finished rerecording her debut album but was only about a "quarter" of the way through rerecording "Reputation."

"To be perfectly honest, it’s the one album in those first 6 that I thought couldn’t be improved upon by redoing it," she said of "Reputation," noting that she did have "unreleased tracks" from her original recording sessions for the album.
Swift added that "Taylor's Versions" of the albums may still "re-emerge" if it's something fans "would be excited about."
"But if it happens, it won’t be from a place of sadness and longing for what I wish I could have. It will just be a celebration now," she wrote.
Swift celebrated her news by sharing four photos on Instagram, all of which showed her on the floor surrounded by vinyl editions of her first six albums.
She captioned the images, "You belong with me."

title: Taylor Swift Says She Now Owns Her Music — and Reveals Status of ‘Reputation’ and Debut Rerecords
summary: Taylor Swift revealed on her site that she owns all her music after a yearslong controversy about the ownership of her first six albums.
story: After a yearslong controversy surrounding the ownership of her first six records — and the subsequent rollout of several albums that she rerecorded — Taylor Swift has revealed she now owns her master recordings.
In a letter to fans posted May 30 on her website, Swift wrote, “All of the music I’ve ever made... now belongs... to me.”

“To say this is my greatest dream come true is actually being pretty reserved about it. To my fans, you know how important this has been to me — so much so that I meticulously re-recorded and released 4 of my albums, calling them Taylor’s Version. The passionate support you showed those albums and the success story you turned The Eras Tour into is why I was able to buy back my music. I can’t thank you enough for helping to reunite me with this art that I have dedicated my life to, but have never owned until now.”

This saga dates back to 2019 when music executive Scooter Braun bought Swift’s former record label Big Machine Records — and the master recordings of her first six albums. Those masters were then sold to a Shamrock Capital in 2020, and in November of that year, Swift said she had begun rerecording her first six albums.

In a statement to TODAY.com regarding Swift’s purchase of her masters, Braun said, “I am happy for her.” Shamrock said in a statement to TODAY.com, “We are thrilled with this outcome and are so happy for Taylor.”

She’s gone on to release four rerecordings — “Fearless” (2021), “Red” (2021), “Speak Now” (2023) and “1989” (2023) — all dubbed “Taylor’s Version” to signify that she owns the master recording of the new work.
She had yet to rerelease two of the six albums she made under Big Machine: “Reputation” from 2017 and her self-titled debut album from 2006.
So now that Swift owns her old music, will she move forward with her last two rereleases? Here’s what she said.
What Taylor Swift Said About 'Reputation (Taylor's Version)'
In her letter posted to her website, Swift gave an update on where “Reputation (Taylor’s Version)” stands.

“I know, I know. What about Rep TV? Full transparency: I haven’t even re-recorded a quarter of it,” she wrote. “The Reputation album was so specific to that time in my life, and I kept hitting a stopping point when I tried to remake it. All that defiance, that longing to be understood while feeling purposely misunderstood, that desperate hope, that shame-born snarl and mischief.”

“Reputation,” as many fans know, has a controversial past. The album dropped in November 2017 after nearly a year of Swift staying largely out of the spotlight, following a public fallout with Kanye West and his then-wife Kim Kardashian. (You can read all about that saga in full here.)

The abbreviated version: In 2016, Swift’s feud with West (who now goes by Ye) reached new heights after he released his song “Famous,” featuring a vulgar lyric about Swift, which she denounced. Kardashian later published a video clip that seemingly showed Swift approving the name drop. The singer was branded a “snake” and hashtags like “#KimExposedTaylorParty” went viral.
Swift reclaimed the snake imagery with “Reputation” and appeared to reference the feud on the album in songs like “Look What You Made Me Do” and “This Is Why We Can’t Have Nice Things.”
The album demonstrated a lackluster performance when it came to Grammy nominations. But “Reputation” has since become a fan-favorite, and listeners have been eager for its rerelease.
In her letter, Swift said now that though she now owns her master recordings, some tracks from “Reputation (Taylor’s Version)” may be released down the line.

“To be perfectly honest, it’s the one album in those first 6 that I thought couldn’t be improved upon by redoing it. Not the music, or the photos, or the videos. So I kept putting it off. There will be a time (if you’re into the idea) for the unreleased vault tracks from that album to hatch.”
What Taylor Swift Said About Debut's Rerelease

Swift’s debut album, “Taylor Swift,” came in 2006 when she was a emerging country artist in her teens. The Taylor’s Version, she told fans in her letter, is completed and may also be released ... one day.

“I’ve already completely re-recorded my entire debut album, and I really love how it sounds now,” she said. “Those 2 albums can still have their moments to re-emerge when the time is right, if that would be something you guys would be excited about. But if it happens, it won’t be from a place of sadness and longing for what I wish I could have. It will just be a celebration now.”
Read Taylor Swift's Full Letter to Fans
Hi.

I’m trying to gather my thoughts into something coherent, but right now my mind is just a slideshow. A flashback sequence of all the times I daydreamed about, wished for, and pined away for a chance to get to tell you this news. All the times I was thiiiiiiis close, reaching out for it, only for it to fall through. I almost stopped thinking it could ever happen, after 20 years of having the carrot dangled and then yanked away. But that’s all in the past now. I’ve been bursting into tears of joy at random intervals ever since I found out that this is really happening. I really get to say these words:
All of the music I’ve ever made... now belongs... to me.
And all my music videos
All the concert films.
The album art and photography.
The unreleased songs.
The memories. The magic. The madness.
Every single era.
My entire life’s work.

To say this is my greatest dream come true is actually being pretty reserved about it. To my fans, you know how important this has been to me — so much so that I meticulously re-recorded and released 4 of my albums, calling them Taylor’s Version. The passionate support you showed those albums and the success story you turned The Eras Tour into is why I was able to buy back my music. I can’t thank you enough for helping to reunite me with this art that I have dedicated my life to, but have never owned until now.

All I’ve ever wanted was the opportunity to work hard enough to be able to one day purchase my music outright with no strings attached, no partnership, with full autonomy. I will be forever grateful to everyone at Shamrock Capital for being the first people to ever off this to me. The way they’ve handled every interaction we’ve had has been honest, fair, and respectful.
